intro: Triumfetta angulata, commonly known as the angular triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
